content: v_stitch scarfie designed by cow from mars supplies lion brand scarfie yarn 1 skein 6mm j hook yarn needle abbreviations st s = stitch es ​ chain = chain ​ double_crochet = double_crochet ​ fsc = foundation single_crochet ​ notes ● this pattern is suitable for beginners ● gauge is not important my finished scarf measures 8 5 wide and 57 long the width of the scarf can be adjusted by changing the number of fsc in row 1 to any multiple of 2 ● if you are not comfortable with fsc yet you may substitute row 1 with chain 22 however there are many fantastic fsc tutorials out there and i cannot recommend this technique enough for creating a foundation row that is just as stretchy as the rest of the fabric ● as with all scarves if you don t want the scarf to develop a twist make sure you turn it clockwise on odd rounds and counter-clockwise on even rounds or vice versa i like to attach a stitch marker to one edge and make sure that the side with the stitch marker always passes in front when turning instructions row 1 22 fsc ​ row 2 chain 2 turn 2 double_crochet in 2nd fsc this forms one v_stitch *skip 1 st 2 double_crochet in next st* repeat from ​ * to * 8 more times skip 1 st 1 double_crochet in last st row 3 chain 2 turn 2 double_crochet in the space between each 2 double_crochet in previous row then 1 double_crochet in the 2nd chain ​ of the turning chain repeat row 3 until scarf is long enough or until you ve almost used up the entire skein last row chain 1 turn single_crochet in each double_crochet in previous row and in the 2nd chain of the turning chain finish ​ off and weave in ends 1 how to work 2 double_crochet in the space between 2 double_crochet in previous row in the photo below i have just chained 2 and turned the arrow indicates where to place the next 2 double_crochet and here s a photo after completing 2 double_crochet 2
